comments.body: Dragonfish are real animals that are actually peaceful but I still like the idea of a scary fish that live underground. Maybe make it an eel?
Cool idea, but Mojang has said before that they won't make new hostile mobs based off of real life creatures. So if they were to add something like this, it would have to be a fantasy mob.

I too would like it to spread upwards. I'm on Xbox, and was so looking forward to this Beta. But quickly became disappointed that it would spread up the walls, underwater, or anywhere something is sitting. But hopefully it can grow up walls someday.

Melly Dow, deepslate only marginally requires more time to mine, so having to place moss, bonemeal it, then mine out the new moss, doesn't reduce much, if any, mining time; mainly just serving to make the process more tedious.
Ooga booga booga
The whole point of copper is to use it for utility, and the devs already said there would be no copper armor.

there already is a wooden shield tho..

Just like every other player who suggested copper tools and armor, you gave no reason as to why it should be added that is more than "it would be cool" or "so it would be the same as iron and gold"

Rather than copper armor/tools, make bronze and brass armor/tools (smithing table upgrades from iron and gold armor, like netherite) they have different designs. (like netherite armor) Brass would be a more durable version of gold, and bronze would be a more durable version of iron (or maybe it would have some other special feature)

I think having cliffs is a great idea, but not because of the name of the update.

they only said "caves and 'cliffs'" because of the alliteration it produced, it wasnt meant to actually be about CLIFFS

Jaxon Colquitt, I can see where you got the wrong idea. I was trying to make the title sound a bit more catchy, as that sometimes helps to get peoples attention! I can see where you got that wrong, but thanks for trying to help!
nom nom
Maybe you could acually craft tridents with this material.
Instead of crafting Tridents, it could be nice for repairing them.

I like the Aquamarine idea for under water gear, it sounds very reasonable being as I spend a lot of time in the water.

On a slightly different topic I think it would be great to be able to craft an Aquarium to have in your builds  working out the logistics is a bit of a process and one I would leave to you all but you can't deny it would be very cool.

Just food for thought.

Thanks

We already have an underwater weapon, the trident. Plus, Aqua Affinity is literally the same thing as having tools dig faster underwater. Just because the Nether Update added new armor and weapons, that doesn't mean every update has to.
Yeah this update seems more like the caves and cliffs and water update and so I think this would be perfect!

I somewhat agree with OnionSOUPSS. Just making an ore provide more armor and weapons doesn't really make it unique or particularly useful. That's why we have seen no mention or hint of Copper Armor. There are already types of armor and weapons that are not being used. Aquamarine should rather have unique uses of its own.
Oh, I hope that isn't the case. Hopefully, the oak logs are just a temporary replacement.
Also, proper waterfalls.
Ok, but what they should be used for?
They should add rubies back in
The resistor is a good idea.
This doesn't really belong in the Caves & Cliffs feedback section.

I had it typed so nicely, spaced out and organized.....oh well, now its a blob. Lol

As far as the breif mention of garlic........perhaps it can be only found in flower fields or very occasionally when you break grass, but you can only find it in the overworld topside. It should have to be cultivated and eaten or crafted into something else consumable or wearable, perhaps a special garlic tipped arrow causing a poision effect on vampires or an temporary immunity from vampire and bat bites.

Also tamed bats would be able to distract the phantoms or attack as they get within 10 blocks much like they do with the warden. Untamed cave bats will be aggresive if spooked and do not hear the ringing of amethysts.
Untamed cave bats may turn into vampires if transported to & attacked in the nether.
No, I would hate the Idea of Vampires. I am a bit squeamish and that would completely ruin Minecraft for me.
This needs to happen as I want to ram enemies and watch them on my head
You should make the name a bit more clearer, like "Abandoned Miners Shaft." But except for that it is great and could be added
Yes, it should be available it creative. I'm pretty sure this is coming.
We should also get basalt walls & stairs (just a normal stone block set for basalt)

Stone types should have a rule of having each type of variation: regular, cobble, smooth/polished, bricks, cracked bricks, tiled, chiseled and of course mossy (plus slabs, stairs, and walls). Simply smelt a block to crack them, craft them with moss for mossy or craft in stonecutter, to, uh, cut them. Surely its just a matter of making a texture for each and giving it a tag like "crackable" or something?
I actually thought of a cave biome of the same name! Idea would be that it'd grant players a way to get wood (purple mushroom stems) underground!

I actually prefer the new ores exept the iron one but overrall im not a fan of this idea.
Tought, it my opinion, and i can see why others old player ( yes im old but im bad ) will like the idea.
I agree 100%, as an OG player the new ores especially the iron ore are such an eyesore so pls make this a thing kind of like the Original texture pack.

Yea, the entire nether as a whole just hurts my eyes when using the old texture pack xD

 

I think the ores are fine atm except for redstone, that one needs to change

There is also the Texture Update Beta pack, by the way, which has all of the current textures with the exception of the new ores and the new Zombified Piglins. I'm also sure someone would be willing to design such a texture pack (perhaps for free on the Marketplace).

I've seen many people talking about the color differences in the ores. After playing myself, I suggest that you make the iron ore the color white. When you mine for it has a tanish color, where as diamond has that bright blue when recognized. Do the same for the iron when mining for it. Have it shine as white colorish.
Very decent idea, though maybe it could have some special enchantments.
yes it needs special enchantments
I don't think this weapon fits in the deep dark. it should be added in the promised desert update.

Great idea, but the fact, that we can repair the Scythe only with Netherite makes no sense, since Netherite is from the Nether, and the Skulk seemingly is NOT from the Nether...maybe, they can't be repaired at all (mending only), or repaired with other Scythes...
This might already work, since it is fully dependent on the hardness of the block itself. Have you tested it?
Ziad El-Moursy no it does not.
Okay, then in order for it to become instant-mineable, its hardness will have to be decreased, increasing mining-speed in general. I don't think I agree with that.
It should be golden pickaxes that do that. It would add more to the strategy to mining idea that the team are going for.

I just played in the newest snapshot, 21w13a, and even with a Netherite pickaxe, Eff 5, and Haste 2 beacon, deepslate/grimstone is not insta-mineable. This is something that should be added for Netherite over Diamond. Diamond should still be able to instamine regular stone, but the deep stuff, netherite shou;d be king.
absolutely agree. there's currently no insentive to use netherite over diamond with a pick.

Yes! I don't want a wall of sitting pets. It's dangerous for them to follow me everywhere though. Give us an in between. Let the pets roam. If we have them follow us into an enclosed house or in a fenced area then tell them to roam, they can't get out. But if we tell them to roam in a free range area they might roam a bit far. That's realistic
Yes, this is a great idea!!! It should of been added by now

Just please don't replace it with granite.

Also, I think there's a typo in the title.
Yeah, agreed maybe it can get replaced by a new rock

replace it with diorite, i agree the andestite looks terrible with the grimstone

 

maybe they could replace it with calcite tho instead?
I like it.
The tradeoff of using a Elytra is that it takes alway most of your Protection, combining it with a Chestplate would be overwhelming
the point of the elytra is to sacrifice defence for mobility kiddo
Mabye the earthquake enchantment could be used to attack players using shields and with the slowness of the hammer it would stop it from being overpowered.
Sounds awesome I hope mojang sees it!
isnt the default stone already slate
What if grimstone had tougher versions of the normal overworld ores that require a diamond pickaxe to mine?
Noah Boyd, that could be cool, but not diamond. Just one tier up maybe.
